trans-unit.source: Setting up a DSC web pull server
trans-unit.target: Setting up a DSC web pull server

trans-unit.source: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 5.0
trans-unit.target: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 5.0

trans-unit.source: A DSC web pull server is a web service in IIS that uses an OData interface to make DSC configuration files available to target nodes when those nodes ask for them.
trans-unit.target: A DSC web pull server is a web service in IIS that uses an OData interface to make DSC configuration files available to target nodes when those nodes ask for them.

trans-unit.source: Requirements for using a pull server:
trans-unit.target: Requirements for using a pull server:

trans-unit.source: A server running:
trans-unit.target: A server running:

trans-unit.source: WMF/PowerShell 4.0 or greater
trans-unit.target: WMF/PowerShell 4.0 or greater

trans-unit.source: IIS server role
trans-unit.target: IIS server role

trans-unit.source: DSC Service
trans-unit.target: DSC Service

trans-unit.source: Ideally, some means of generating a certificate, to secure credentials passed to the Local Configuration Manager (LCM) on target nodes
trans-unit.target: Ideally, some means of generating a certificate, to secure credentials passed to the Local Configuration Manager (LCM) on target nodes

trans-unit.source: You can add the IIS server role and DSC Service with the Add Roles and Features wizard in Server Manager, or by using PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: You can add the IIS server role and DSC Service with the Add Roles and Features wizard in Server Manager, or by using PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: The sample scripts included in this topic will handle both of these steps for you as well.
trans-unit.target: The sample scripts included in this topic will handle both of these steps for you as well.

trans-unit.source: Using the xWebService resource
trans-unit.target: Using the xWebService resource

trans-unit.source: The easiest way to set up a web pull server is to use the xWebService resource, included in the xPSDesiredStateConfiguration module.
trans-unit.target: The easiest way to set up a web pull server is to use the xWebService resource, included in the xPSDesiredStateConfiguration module.

trans-unit.source: The following steps explain how to use the resource in a configuration that sets up the web service.
trans-unit.target: The following steps explain how to use the resource in a configuration that sets up the web service.

trans-unit.source: Call the Install-Module cmdlet to install the xPSDesiredStateConfiguration module.
trans-unit.target: Call the Install-Module cmdlet to install the xPSDesiredStateConfiguration module.

trans-unit.source: Note: Install-Module is included in the PowerShellGet module, which is included in PowerShell 5.0.
trans-unit.target: Note: Install-Module is included in the PowerShellGet module, which is included in PowerShell 5.0.

trans-unit.source: You can download the PowerShellGet module for PowerShell 3.0 and 4.0 at PackageManagement PowerShell Modules Preview.
trans-unit.target: You can download the PowerShellGet module for PowerShell 3.0 and 4.0 at PackageManagement PowerShell Modules Preview.

trans-unit.source: Create a self-signed certificate with the subject "CN=PSDSCPullServerCert" in the CERT:\LocalMachine\MY\ store.
trans-unit.target: Create a self-signed certificate with the subject "CN=PSDSCPullServerCert" in the CERT:\LocalMachine\MY\ store.

trans-unit.source: You can do this with the command New-SelfSignedCertificate -CertStoreLocation 'CERT:\LocalMachine\MY' -Subject 'CN=PSDSCPullServerCert'.
trans-unit.target: You can do this with the command New-SelfSignedCertificate -CertStoreLocation 'CERT:\LocalMachine\MY' -Subject 'CN=PSDSCPullServerCert'.

trans-unit.source: In the PowerShell ISE, start (F5) the following configuration script (included in the unzipped files as Sample_xDscWebService.ps1).
trans-unit.target: In the PowerShell ISE, start (F5) the following configuration script (included in the unzipped files as Sample_xDscWebService.ps1).

trans-unit.source: This script sets up the pull server and a compliance server.
trans-unit.target: This script sets up the pull server and a compliance server.

trans-unit.source: Run the configuration, passing the thumbprint of the self-signed certificate you created as the certificateThumbPrint parameter:
trans-unit.target: Run the configuration, passing the thumbprint of the self-signed certificate you created as the certificateThumbPrint parameter:

trans-unit.source: Registration Key
trans-unit.target: Registration Key

trans-unit.source: To allow client nodes to register with the server so that they can use configuration names instead of a configuration ID, a registration key (which is a GUID known to both the server and the client node) must be placed in a file named RegistrationKeys.txt.
trans-unit.target: To allow client nodes to register with the server so that they can use configuration names instead of a configuration ID, a registration key (which is a GUID known to both the server and the client node) must be placed in a file named RegistrationKeys.txt.

trans-unit.source: By default, the pull server created by this example expects that file to be located in C:\Program Files\WindowsPowerShell\DscService.
trans-unit.target: By default, the pull server created by this example expects that file to be located in C:\Program Files\WindowsPowerShell\DscService.

trans-unit.source: Create a text file with only one line consisting of the registration key and save it in that folder.
trans-unit.target: Create a text file with only one line consisting of the registration key and save it in that folder.

trans-unit.source: Note: Registration keys are not supported in PowerShell 4.0.
trans-unit.target: Note: Registration keys are not supported in PowerShell 4.0.

trans-unit.source: Placing configurations and resources
trans-unit.target: Placing configurations and resources

trans-unit.source: After the pull server setup completes, there is a new folder under $env:PROGRAMFILES\WindowsPowerShell named "DscService".
trans-unit.target: After the pull server setup completes, there is a new folder under $env:PROGRAMFILES\WindowsPowerShell named "DscService".

trans-unit.source: In that folder, there are two folders named "Modules" and "Configuration".
trans-unit.target: In that folder, there are two folders named "Modules" and "Configuration".

trans-unit.source: In the "Modules" folder, place any resources that are needed for configurations that nodes will pull from this server.
trans-unit.target: In the "Modules" folder, place any resources that are needed for configurations that nodes will pull from this server.

trans-unit.source: In the "Configuration" folder, place the configuration MOF files for any configurations that are to be pulled by nodes.
trans-unit.target: In the "Configuration" folder, place the configuration MOF files for any configurations that are to be pulled by nodes.

trans-unit.source: The names of the MOF files depend on the type of pull client.
trans-unit.target: The names of the MOF files depend on the type of pull client.

trans-unit.source: The following topics describe setting up pull clients in detail:
trans-unit.target: The following topics describe setting up pull clients in detail:
